english: to leave; separate; be apart from; detach

etymology.description: ideogrammic: 林 ‘forest’ + 𠦒 ‘net’ — to set up a net in the forest; later evolved via 艸 > 屮 > 亠 and 𠦒 > ⿱凶禸.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicts setting a net in the woods for hunting, evoking the idea of separating or taking away. The graphic was later stylized into 离, and its meaning generalized to leaving or being apart; it was also repurposed as the simplified form of 離.
etymology.simplification: The PRC adopted the historically attested, simpler graph 离 to replace 離, effectively dropping the semantic 隹 ‘bird’ and retaining the phonetic 离, reducing strokes while preserving pronunciation and common meanings.

examples.chinese: 我们要离开北京了(我們要離開北京了)。
这里离市中心很远(這裡離市中心很遠)。
examples.english: This place is far from the city center.

examples.chinese: 他们决定离婚(他們決定離婚)。
